snippet: Kevin O’Dowd, a close lieutenant of Gov. Chis Christie’s since his days as United States attorney, is resigning to become an executive at Cooper Hospital in Camden.
abstract: Kevin O'Dowd, New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's chief of staff, says he will resign his job to become an executive at Cooper Hospital in Camden; Christie had intended to nominate O'Dowd as state attorney general but George Washington Bridge closings scandal, which implicated administration official Bridget Anne Kelly, who reported to O'Dowd, cast pall on likelihood he would survive confirmation hearings.
lead_paragraph: Kevin O’Dowd, a close lieutenant of Gov. Chis Christie’s since his days as United States attorney, is resigning to become an executive at Cooper Hospital in Camden.

headline.main: Christie’s Chief of Staff Quits for a Hospital Job
headline.print_headline: Christie’s Chief of Staff Quits for a Hospital Job
